Capture villains and put them in your pile for points. The hero with the most points wins. Sounds simple, right? Yeah right, keep dreaming!

None of you are the most honest of heroes. Steal and discard villains from your friends' piles, or even reverse the rules, in this fast and unpredictable game that keeps everyone scrambling to stay in the lead!

155736.description:
ATS BASIC GAME II continues to Carentan with an all-new 2-piece board! The module adds a set of scenarios + a BG II rulebook and play aids! You can dive right in and begin experiencing the battle while mastering the system. The map is not printed on paper, and instead consists of TWO 12" × 18" BOARDS you are sure to enjoy! What's more, the presentation allows you to use your existing ATS counters from your collection for a low cost battle experience.

An Expansion for ATS. First released edition does NOT include counters needed for play. Counters needed from a previous game with American/German units, or available direct from Critical Hit.
155736.name: Advanced Tobruk System Basic Game II: Action at Carentan

155737.description:
ATS BASIC GAME II is back and brings you into the heart of Normandy's bocage country in this new edition that remasters the D-Day Rangers map terrain and adds a set of scenarios + a BG II rulebook and play aids! You can dive right in and begin mastering the system right away. The map is not printed on paper, and instead consists of TWO 12" × 18" BOARDS you are sure to enjoy! What's more, the presentation allows you to use your existing ATS counters from the collection for a low cost battle experience.

An Expansion for ATS. First released edition does NOT include counters needed for play. Counters needed from a previous game with American/German units, or available direct from Critical Hit.
155737.name: Advanced Tobruk System Basic Game II: Busting the Bocage

155738.name: Advanced Tobruk System Basic Game II: Stalin's Fury
155738.description:
The original ATS BG II is back in Stalingrad and uses a new 12" × 18" board (card, not paper) and standard ATS sized hexes. An updated BG II rulebook and play aids provide everything you need to play—just bring your own counters from the ATS collection—and begins you on the path to system experience at a low cost.

An Expansion for ATS. First released edition does NOT include counters needed for play. Counters needed from a previous Complete Game with Russian/German units, or available direct from Critical Hit.

155739.description: Win with your words in a speed game based on the addictive online game! Start with the longest word you can make with your first 9 tiles, and then race to see who can get the most words on the grid. Don't worry about taking turns! Extend other players' words, play right through them, and get rid of all your tiles first to win! Or play in Score mode and score points for every word, double word and triple word you've got on the board. Word up with the WORDS WITH FRIENDS Race game! Includes 100 tiles and portable case.
155739.name: Words with Friends: Race

155740.description:
It is the Battle of the Bulge and once again some of the finest soldiers ever birthed by a great nation ... are standing firm ... against the violent force of an entire Panzer Division. There is no turning back on the road to Bastogne, the linchpin to Hitler's last offensive ... and the scene of Fateful Stand ... replete with new counter art, a full collection of combat counters in Winter gear and camo schemes. Baby, it's cold outside! But we aim to warm the hearts of tactical-level gamers north and south of the equator.

COMPONENT-WISE: ATS Fateful Stand is an ATS Expansion. Requires ownership of any ATS Complete game or the ATS Rules, Play Aids, status markers to play.

This is a ziplock ATS Historical Module that includes everything you need to play just bring your ATS Rulebook/Play Aids/10-sided dice. The counters are the original ATS --3/4", 5/8"-- widths, and you receive all the counters and markers you need to play. The map is 'winterized' for evocative gaming, historical leaders straight from 'Band of Brothers' ... winter whitewashed tanks ... it is ALL there for your to enjoy.
155740.name: ATS: Fateful Stand

155741.description:
Tips! is a game of hot plates & cold revenge. Hustle for the biggest tips, sabotaging co-workers along the way.

~~~How does it play?~~~~

Serve your customers drinks, appetizers, main dishes and desserts in large quantities. The number of menu items you can serve of each type is constrained by the party size, also the menu items need to be served in a particular order (no dessert before the main meal in this place!). Minimize the number of times you get an order wrong, have customers run out the door without paying, and taking annoying restroom breaks (try to just hold it in!).

At the end of the game, each player counts up their tips - whoever has the most wins!
155741.name: Tips!

155742.name: Death in the Caribbean
155742.description:
User Summary

Your on a caribbean island with the only know map to the legendary lost pirates treasure. Overcome the obstacles that lie in your way and strike it rich!

The game is a graphic adventure game that uses two words to interact with the game.

155743.name: Mens erger je niet! Card Game
155743.description:
Translated from the box:
Who collects two complete series of cards first? Use your Joker and Choice cards well and avoid being hit by your opponents.

Gameplay:
Start with 3 cards. Take a card, play a card. Collect series of 6 cards. Your Start card determines in which order to build the series: up, down or random. Close a series with a Home card.
You can hit on the last cards in an opponents series using Tease cards as long as that series isn't completed with a Home card.
Jokers can substitute any number card and can be exchanged for the right number in your turn and must be played again in the same turn.
Choice cards make you turn extra cards from the deck (as many as there are players). You get to choose first. Don't forget to end your turn with just 3 cards in hand. The other players have to fullfil that condition at their respective turns.

155745.description:
The first expansion for Stak Bots, the battling robots card game.

More Bots! More fun! More mayhem!
Explore brand new Bot abilities and entry effects; add them to your original set and try playing one of several new game variations!

This is an expansion for the original game, but can be played on its own by using the online instructions for the original set.
155745.name: Stak Bots: Yellow Expansion

155746.name: Was Großmütterchen erzählt
155746.description:
Goal: Be the first racing to position '50'

Game Play:
Typical 'roll & move' game - Roll the die by turns and step forward - ending on a marked space follow instructions glued into the lid.

Notes:
Likely published late 1920's/early 30's

155747.name: Im Märchen= und Wunderland
155747.description:
Goal: Be the first to race to position '50' (back home);
learn more about fairy tales

Game Play:
Typical 'roll & move' game - Roll the die by turns and step forward - ending on a marked space follow instructions.

155748.name: Lincoln: Se Met au Vert
155748.description:
This game is based on the French comics "Lincoln".

From the publisher:

Lincoln is a speed and observation game where Lincoln and his friends need help to find their missing objects.

The game mechanism is such that when a combination of cards triggers the action of a player, he is not the only one to score points, but the other players could also get some, if they are fast enough.

155749.name: Braintown
155749.description:
Cerebronians are here! And they are invading Earth! Well... They are invading Braintown... but eventually...

Braintown is a game for 2 to 5 players who play as cerebronians: mind controlling alliens. The cerebronians want to start their invasion and they need to choose a good leader. The best cerebronians are selected to compete in a real invasion scenario: Braintown, a little town populated by normal and weird citizens.

Each player uses his or her dice to control cards by getting high values and by throwing them in the correct place over the field.

Each player will have an objective. Each objective consists in eliminating some inhabitants. The first player to achieve his or her objective, wins the game and becomes the leading cerebronian!

155750.name: Halali
155750.description:
Objective: Get as many bonus points as possible
- acting by turns -
Each player gets 3 x 3 cards; cards show animals (mostly herbivores and a few carnivores) and the hunter; each card has a special value, which adds up to a total sum of 220 points;

Active player plays a herbivore out of a given class eg. (4) birds, rated from 1-4 /the higher the number the stronger). Next player must play a card of this class; if he/she hasn't any there is a choice to play a matching carnivore or discard a random card. Trick is made by the carnivore player or highest rating within demanded class. Hunter card can be used as a joker, points can be doubled under certain circumstances (announcements).

Notes:
Different from 1966 published 'Halali' (Happy Families) card game (same publisher)

155751.name: JD2: Darkland Moors
155751.description:
From publisher blurb:

A huge, monstrous presence rampages through the farms and villages of Darkland Moors, throwing the locals’ formerly peaceful lives into turmoil. What manner of giant is responsible, where is it taking its captives, and what is their fate? To restore peace, our heroes must scour the misty Moors and track the beast to its lair! This is the sequel to JD1 Cess-Pit of the Bog-Mother!

This module was originally created as a stretch goal for Jeff Dee’s Kickstarter project to re-create his lost paintings from the covers of the classic RPG adventures A1 Slave Pits of the Undercity, A3 Assault on the Aerie of the Slave Lords, and C2 The Ghost Tower of Inverness. The author wishes to thank all of his backers, whose support made this work possible.

Included are three alternate introductions to this outdoor adventure, stat blocks for the standard creatures which appear herein, complete stats for unique creatures especially designed for the adventure, plus GM and player maps.

155752.name: Typhoon Freight Train
155752.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible vehicle. The vehicle introduced in this installment of the series is a heavy duty freight train.

The PDF contains the background of the vehicle and statistics for its use as well as an illustration.

155753.name: Dotto
155753.description:
Based on the 1958-1960 ITV quiz show of the same name, which in turn was based on the short-lived 1958 CBS/NBC "Scandal-Rigged" American game show of the same name.

Players only get to join dots by answering questions on specific subjects. The harder the question attempted, the more dots the player is entitled to join together on that turn. After joining 25 dots the host sets the first clue to help identify the picture. A second clue was given at 35 dots, and a final clue at 40 dots. These clues should be written by the host and disclosed only to the relevant player.

A player calls "Dotto" if the picture is recognized at any stage of the game. The answer is given and written to the host, undisclosed to their opponent. More points are awarded for earlier recognition as each unconnected dot earned 5 points. A player must give the name of the picture to the host once all the dots are joined. The host announces whether the guess is correct or not. If correct, the second player has one attempt to guess and so draw the game. If drawn the game is repeated.

Alternative games can be played such as double Dotto where the value of the dots is doubled. If a player gives an incorrect answer the game is over. The opponent received no points but is victorious and remains to fight a new challenger. Any number of rounds may be played, at the end of which the player with the highest points scored is the winner.

155754.description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

In early November 1942, American and British forces stormed ashore in French-ruled Morocco and Algeria, beginning a campaign to press the Axis into a small bridgehead around the ports of Tunis and Bizerte in Tunisia. The U.S. Army had its first exposure to combat in the European Theater, while fresh British forces joined the veteran Eighth Army against the Axis. French troops fought first against the Allies, then with them. Inside the shrinking perimeter, German and Italian units continued to offer fierce resistance.

An Army at Dawn is a complete boxed game in the Panzer Grenadier series based on these battles. The game includes four semi-rigid mapboards, with art by Guy Riessen. The maps are fully compatible with many others in the Panzer Grenadier series (and those from Panzer Grenadier (Modern) and Infantry Attacks, too). There are 517 playing pieces: ultra-thick, scorchless, sootless laser-cut. You do not need any other game to play any of its 40 scenarios. Design is by Mike Perryman, creator of Liberation 1944 and Kursk: Burning Tigers among other titles.
155754.name: Panzer Grenadier: An Army at Dawn

155755.description:
Cave Escape is a push-your-luck dice game for 2 to 6 players where people are in a cavern that is about to collapse.

The players are working to be the first to escape from a 5,000ft deep cavern while making sure that no one gets out before them by sabotaging the other players. The first player to get their meeple top the 5,000ft mark is the winner and survives - the rest of the players are dead. Sorry!

The game adds a cutthroat twist to traditional push-your-luck mechanisms for you can sabotage another player's roll so that they lose it all or force them to quit rolling. It also allows players to get farther faster with special dice that they can purchase on their turn with adrenaline tokens.
155755.name: Cave Escape

155756.description:
Obliterate your enemies in this tactical war game of epic robot battle.

Kingdom Bots is a fast-paced competitive board game for 3 to 4 players. Each player controls a unique faction of robots with the objective to build a civilization while attacking and defending against other robot armies. It's a 3-4 hour, constantly evolving game of world domination that rewards aggressive gameplay and clever strategy.

Stunning comic book style artwork immerses you in this world of hack-and-slash robots. The art is showcased on the revolutionary new Command Card mechanic, which brings a level of strategy to the game that even new players can pick up only a few turns into their first game.

-STORY-
The world of Kingdom Bots is set far into the future. Mankind has vanished, leaving behind only relics and rubble. Machines that were once built for menial service have developed self-awareness and evolved to become the new form of dominant life upon the earth.

Like-minded robots found new kingdoms. Diggers who now worship rocks. Maintenance droids who now assemble patchwork monstrosities and builders who can only see one blueprint for the design of new bots. The different ideologies fall into conflict. But instead of learning from the mistakes of the fallen empire that created them, the robots find themselves driven by the old programming. To build. To grow. No matter what… or who is in the way.

What’s left of the world is yours for the taking.
155756.name: Kingdom Bots

155757.name: Mythic Traps
155757.description:
From publisher blurb:

Devious Dangers Around Every Corner!

Traps have long had room for improvement. What should be an exciting encounter that leaves players on the edge of their seats holding their breath and wondering if they’ll make it out alive instead winds up reduced to a few cursory rolls, and players either shrugging off the damage or feeling that they are being punished for not being paranoid about checking each and every hallway. There are ways to avoid this, of course, but wouldn’t it be better to have some traps that are built specifically in order to be exciting and engaging encounters in and of themselves?

Enter the mythic trap: these dastardly devices make use of mythic rules and mythic power to come alive in your game, in more ways than one. A mythic trap acts like a monster or NPC, taking turns in initiative order, and using (under the GM’s guidance) one or more of its devilish and hazardous components. They provide traps that are fun and engaging on several levels, and cannot be ignored in the same way that a simple pit trap or poison dart trap can be.

This book introduces rules for mythic traps, which can be run easily in both mythic and non-mythic campaigns, and also provides four specific mythic traps to serve as examples. Brave the efreeti’s tomb trap, dodging fireball-spitting statues while navigating over a rune-covered floor to reach safety. Or try your luck at the hall of horrors trap, and try to choose between staying in the middle of the room—where the floor is rapidly disappearing, leaving quicksand in its wake—and the walls, from which spring dozens of deadly spears. Perhaps you’d prefer the hall of serpents trap, which combines poisonous vapors and poisonous fumes to create a deadly combination, as the walls slowly close in around you? Perhaps the deadliest of all is the mummy’s curse trap, where, among other dangers, you face a room quickly filling with suffocating sand, swarms of angry scarabs, and possibly a mythic mummy, as well!

155758.name: Shellback
155758.description:
From publisher blurb:

Shellback is a story roleplaying game about the strange events surrounding the USS Enterprise (CVN-65) aircraft carrier, in the spring of 2006. For six days, the ship disappeared from every radar and surveillance known to man. No record exists of this event and the US Navy has redacted every document during the six-day period. True or not, on March 28, the Enterprise reappeared. All of the crew member’s records have been sealed and no reporter has ever been able to piece together the events of those days. No one. Until now.

Each game in the Protocol series is zero-prep for 3 or more players.
The game length is exponentially long, so games with more players take more time to complete. The Protocol Series requires a deck of poker cards as well as tokens to track drama points.

155759.name: Chemical Zoo
155759.description:
From publisher blurb:

Chemical Zoo is a story roleplaying game about a social order of animals, inspired by Animal Farm, Planet of The Apes, and Flowers For Algernon. As a new social order violently dawns, it threatens to shatter the old hierarchy, as each animal struggles to establish agendas of control and tolerance in an ever-changing political landscape. Will the society hold together? Will the violent ways be put down with more violence? Who will arise as the new lords of the animal kingdom?

Who reigns in an age without the Zookeeper?

Each game in the Protocol series is zero-prep for 3 or more players.
The game length is exponentially long, so games with more players take more time to complete. The Protocol Series requires a deck of poker cards as well as tokens to track drama points.

155760.name: Ship Lanterns
155760.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ship Lanterns is a story roleplaying game about wish-fulfillment gone awry and set in a Southeast Asian village. Children gather on a bridge to throw cherry blossoms into the water, asking the river spirit (Thuy-Tinh) to grant their wishes. Characters take on the roles of children, dealing with the results of their wishes.

Each game in the Protocol series is zero-prep for 3 or more players.
The game length is exponentially long, so games with more players take more time to complete. The Protocol Series requires a deck of poker cards as well as tokens to track drama points.

155761.description:
From the Publisher:
Expand KOI POND with new tactics, new characters, and new art! With these cards, you can even add an extra player to your group!

Includes:

20 new Koi cards: 4-Koi in four suits, 2 each; 5-Koi in four suits, 2 each
4 rainbow koi: A special hybrid koi that can be played as any suit
4 Novice cards: Scores for each 1-koi card wherever you place him!
4 Monk cards: Scores for each 2-koi card wherever you place him!
4 Abbot cards: Scores for each 3-koi card wherever you place him!
4 Shrines: One in each suit. A shrine doubles the number of koi wherever you place it!
155761.name: Koi Pond: Moon Temple

141419.name: Koi Pond: A Coy Card Game

155762.description:
Llamanomics (a contraction of Llamas and Economics) is a supply and demand negotiation card game where you use Llamas to buy, transport, and sell goods.

Each turn a player takes a card from the deck. Throughout the deck there are 'Burgermeister' cards. When a 'Burgermeister' card is pulled players may choose to sell any of the commodities they have on their llamas for their current point value (determined by the 'Demand' cards). The values of the different commodities change throughout the game.

During the game, you can play action cards to upgrade your own llamas, or apply negative effects on other players.

The game ends when the deck runs out of cards. The player with the most money wins.


Llamanomics is a card game about supply, demand, and llamas (and the occasional alpaca).

The goal of the game is to get the most valuable commodities and sell them for the most points.
You play as a trader, taking his/her commodities to the market to sell. And what will be carrying your commodities? Why, your trusty llamas! The more llamas you get, the more you can carry. The more you can form corner the market on different commodities and squeeze out your competition. Capitalism style! Llama style!

So, the strategy comes in with 'ACTION CARDS', which allow you to upgrade your llamas, downgrade your competitors llamas, steal llamas, swap commodities, and all sorts of other shenanigans!

'DEMAND CARDS' add yet another element of gameplay as the value of the commodities changes throughout the game.

You have to be clever in placing llamas, commodities and action cards. You have to be even more clever in choosing which other players you will trade with, or harass, make alliances with, and take the free-llama-market by storm!
155762.name: Llamanomics

155763.name: Penny Farthing Catapult
155763.description:
You are well-mannered nobles settling grievances in the time-honored tradition: Dueling catapults attached to old-timey bicycles, launching wealth at each other!

Your goal is to hit and collect valuable items from the track. Unfortunately, your catapult is so rickety, it moves backwards the same distance that you launched!

Try to stay out of range of your opponent's catapults, because if you’re hit, you lose one of your valuables!

155764.description:
The magnet pack is available separately to upgrade your Standard edition of Whacky Roll to the Magnet edition.

The magnet pack contains four magnets to hold down the board on any metal ground and seven magnetic stickers you can put under the wooden items to make them magnetic, so you can play the game on an whiteboard or fridge.
155764.name: Whacky Roll: Magnet Pack

155765.description:
Farm development and trading board game.

The first player to: Repay the loan, build a farmhouse, build Livestock sheds, build Produce sheds, install electricity and water
and buy a tractor is the winner.

- acting by turns -
Each player is given a piece of land, provided with a Government loan, and through wise buying, productivity and selling, has to develop his farm.

Roll the die and move forward; depending on the space you reach you may/have to buy, sell, get, pay...

Notes:
Similar approach to Monopoly, with a guidance for agricultural business.
Quite comparable to Agri-hazard.
155765.name: Agri-Cup: The John Deere Farming Game

155766.name: 7 Dice Wonders: Civilization
155766.description:
A Print And Play dice expansion to the contest winning game "7 Dice Wonders".

The Expansion introduces Battles, as well as more Trade, and more unpredictability.

It is partly based on "7 Wonders: Leaders" by Antoine Bauza from Repos Production.

Variants:

Rulers - adds a new die to the game, and makes it possible to have rulers in your empire - which can be bribed (taken away) by others.

Players roll seven of the eight dice per round (age).

Teams - adds a corporation between two players (or with the bot) for a combined victory or defeat.

Territory - adds an map for the wonders - first come, first serve.

Components:
1 Die. 5 Rulercards. 4 new Scoresheets.

155767.name: Yin Yang
155767.description:
This is a card game.

Cards are covered with 8 yin-yangs which can be red or black.

The winner is the last player with cards in his hand.

Each player in turn tries to lay a card on the cards already laid out. The correspondence of yin-yangs between the card played and the card it covers defines if the move is possible and how many points are obtained.

Basically, each symbol of a colour must be laid out on a symbol of the other colour. A player gets 8 points if his card completely covers the previous one or 4 points if it only covers half.
For each point marked, the player can take a new card from the remaining stack. A player without any card left is excluded.

155768.name: Binary
155768.description:
The goal of the game is to get rid of all your card before anyone else does. However, it is easier said than done and players are limited in the ways they can play cards.

Players can only put down a card on a pile with the same design and color. Each card placed down needs to be higher then the previous one.

The game starts with three open piles. Each pile is played until no players can put down any more cards. At this point the first player who was unable to put down any cards opens up a new pile.

There are 8 special cards in the deck. 6 closing cards, and 2 switching cards. A closing card allows a player to close any pile of the same color, and open up a new one at any point. The switching cards allows a player to switch the color of a pile with the same background color, and the design of a pile to anything they would like. The next card played after a switch card must still be higher then the number under it.

155769.name: Jeu des Échanges: France – Colonies
155769.description:
In this 1941 game, players had to administer France's overseas colonies. They drew cards representing colonies, then had to use the appropriate tools and resources, and manage local labor forces to gain exports from the colonies. A colony would go out of play once its major exports were fully exploited.

Can be played by 2, 4, or 8 players.

155770.name: Mutant: År Noll
155770.description:
User summary:

Mutant: År Noll (Mutant: Year Zero) is the latest version of the classic Swedish role-playing game. The game is set a few years after the apocalypse.

Included in the box set:

Bok 1: Mutanten (Book 1: The Mutant)
Bok 2: Zonen (Book 2: The Zone)
The short story I rötmyrens mörker by Swedish author Anders Fager
Two maps
Special dice (d6)
Cards
Markers

155771.name: The Bombardier: A Dungeon World Playbook
155771.description:
From publisher blurb:

You were not always obsessed with explosions. There was a time when you did something else. Something that brought you into contact with the raw power of gunpowder. You never looked back.

You are the Bombardier.

155772.name: The Street Rat: A Dungeon World Playbook
155772.description:
From publisher blurb:

You grew up on the dirty underbelly of the city. It is your home. It is your community. It is your identity. You feel the life of the city pumping through the soles of your feet when you run the streets. It gives you the power to jump the rooftops, the guts to navigate the dark sewers and the cunning to survive the grand battle for daily survival.

You are The Street Rat.

The Street Rat is a character class designed for Dungeon World. He has some moves similar to that of a thief, but he is an urban acrobat, a social hacker, a devious fighter, and above all, a survivor.

And he has just enough urban magic to give him the awesomeness he deserves.

155773.name: The Clockpunk: A Dungeon World Playbook
155773.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Time wants to be free!” Anonymous.

“If time is a river, the past is a mountain spring. It is fixed and can't be moved. But the future! The future is an infinite delta of possibilities. If you can see it you can bend its course to your fancy...” Hieronymous, infamous timehacker.

You understand the flow of time. You are able to capture the substance of time in mechanical devices, and you know how to harness the energy of time to do work. So you make clockwork timehacking devices that bend and break the flow of time, or harness the energy of this flow to your own benefit.

You are the Clockpunk.

155774.name: Billy Bones: His Book of Nautical Nonpareils and Mechanical Marvels
155774.description:
From publisher blurb:

Being a collection of 50 Seafaring Magical Items and Clockpunk Gadgets for your Dungeon World Pirates! and Clockpunk Campaign.

155775.name: Wasteland Ruins I
155775.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Wasteland Ruins series covers random, often generic, city, town, village, and even random smaller ruin locations for post apocalyptic games. They are meant to be used by GM's looking to set up a quick area for an urban encounter. Don't mistake them for generic though! Each map is highly detailed with random decorative elements put in to make the apocalyptic wastelands feel more alive than ever!

This particular ruin is based around a rail yard inspired by the Amtrak station in Spokane, Washington. Your players will find burning barrels, maintained by someone...or something...that wants to stay warm. There are rusty vehicles and even a couple of old shopping carts. And there are connexes and unopened barrels at the rail station that may contain much needed fuel or supplies. Best of all, there are plenty of places for enemies to hide...or your players to use as cover while they deal with the mutants or raiders they find occupying this desolate location.

Features:

Square, Hex, or No Grid versions. Choose which type of grid you want to use and off you go!
Full Color versions – These maps are printer intensive, full color versions of each level.
Black and White version – Starting with this map, all future maps will only have one version of the black and white map (square grid), due to increasing demand for other types of maps.
Undecorated version - A version of the map contains only the base architectural elements with no decorations (no vehicles or props).
VTT Map – If you prefer to play your games online, there is an included VTT map properly sized for VTT software.

155776.description:
Terrain Expansion for Heroes of Normandie base game.
Introduces rivers to the base game.

Contains:
5 new double sided terrain tiles.
1 punchboard with ruins and explosives.
155776.name: Heroes of Normandie: River-Set Terrain Pack

155777.description:
There are two dogs and six cats. The cats try to steal the Wurst and escape. The dogs have to protect their Wurst. Cats and dogs may move in any direction as many spaces as they roll with one die. Cats can only jump over cats and dogs over dogs. If a dog gets on a space with a cat, he drives the cat from the game board. If the cat has the Wurst, the dog gets really mad and kills the cat. The cats even try to steal the wurst from each other. If a cat escapes with the Wurst, it wins the game. A dog has to kill three cats to win the game (nice doggy).

This game was published in the 1930s or 40s.
155777.name: Es geht um die Wurst

155778.name: EP0CH.2
155778.description:
EPOCH has trekked across a war-ravaged country to find the one person he was programmed to protect: the Princess, Amelia. Now he must follow a final, desperate lead to reach her, with the two warring robot armies of Omegatroniks and Alphetekk standing in his way. But what surprises await EPOCH when the Princess is finally located? And what will she make of the world she wakes up to?

The sequel to Uppercut’s first and wildly popular game, EPOCH 2 is a frantic cover shooter set in a ruined world where only robots are left to fight … except that maybe humanity isn’t as extinct as we first thought.

With a massively expanded world to explore, new weapons, gadgets and enemies, new tactics and moves, and a new mystery to solve, EPOCH 2 is the ultimate cover shooter on iOS.

CHOREOGRAPH THE ACTION

Control your character with intuitive finger swipes designed specifically for touch-screens. Make split-second tactical decisions, take cover, select targets, dodge incoming fire, utilize special abilities, and launch countermeasures!

UNRAVEL THE MYSTERY

Follow the story of humanity’s downfall, and their final hope for salvation as you discover the truth about the Princess and what she really means to the future of this world. And who is the new interloper that has decided that EPOCH must be stopped at any cost?

A BEAUTIFULLY DESOLATE WORLD

Explore whole new areas across a post-apocalyptic landscape; the crackling desert of the mysteriously drained harbors, the whistling desolation of abandoned spaceports and the clamorous factories that continue to manufacture their robotic wares.

DESTROY, SALVAGE AND UPGRADE

Battle escalating waves of robots and bosses in arena-style combat, and upgrade yourself with pieces scavenged from the ruins! Configure your robot with dozens of weapons, armors, boosters and counters.

NEW WAYS TO PLAY

New weapons, items and features expand your arsenal and give you new strategies to employ. Equip your Weakening Grenades, risk a Fast Reload for bonus damage, or head-shot an enemy robot with your Sniper Rifle? New levels extend and expand EPOCH’s ability to fight, move and dodge. New Play Modes provide tougher challenges for the elite EPOCH player.

ENGAGING STORY

Help the Princess find her bearings in a world that has left her behind. Gather fragments of the past with logs from a cast of characters, each with their own perspective on the apocalyptic events that destroyed a once-proud civilization.

STUNNING AAA VISUALS

Powered by the latest version of Unreal Engine 3 – as used by Infinity Blade 3 – EPOCH.2 pushes the limits of the enhanced visual capabilities of the latest iOS devices, delivering spectacular new enemies, completely revamped models and the most amazingly-realised human character on mobile!

Source: The Developer Website.

155780.description:
Steampunked is a game of strategy, subtlety, and sabotage. Players work against one another to be the first to assemble a time machine using turn of the century "Steam Punk" inspired components.

The first player to assemble their 9-part time machine and end their turn wins the game. However, this is easier said than done. This is the point in the game where the fur really starts to fly! Action cards are played in rapid succession as your opponents attempt to break and disassemble your machine in order to get parts for their own creation. The only way to assure your victory is to employ a multitude of strategies including, hording parts, conserving energy, forming alliances, and, of course, breaking said alliances at the most opportune moment!

Steampunked Time Machine is a card game with a core set made for 2 players. The game can however be expanded via additional expansion cards and 'booster packs' to play with up to 6 players.
155780.name: Steampunked Time Machine

155781.name: Bake Shop Drop
155781.description:
A match-three game featuring pastries. Players drop a single pastry from the top of a display case onto pastries of the same type below attempting to make groups of three or more and thus clear the screen of pastries.

From the developer:
This Bakery has been on Main Street for 85 years! The head pastry chef, Mr. Gingerbread Man, has perfected how to bring these pastries TO LIFE! His goal is to keep the shelves empty… won’t you help him???

A fun, easy to play, hard to master game of yummy pastry matching! Caution: causes deep desire for sweet baked goods.

Source: The Developer Website.

155782.name: Age of Piracy
155782.description:
It is the Caribbean in the 16th century. New lands have been discovered, and the stories about riches and influence on the new continent are abound in the old world. Resources aplenty cause the royal dynasties of Europe to secure huge chunks of
the new world. They send out brave captains and seamen to gather influence for their own country.

Set sail and head west, your monarch needs you.

155783.name: Find 15
155783.description:
Find 15 is a fast-paced word game where you must find the 15 hidden words as fast as you can.

Race the timer and beat your friends in this simple yet challenging word game. Do you have what it takes to find 15.

Source: The Publisher Website.

155784.name: Farm Heroes Saga
155784.description:
Farm Heroes Saga is a switcher game that focuses on a collection mechanic. The game is set in a fantasy farmland world with over 380 levels. The game requires players to collect different farm elements such as carrots, apples, beetroots and water by matching at least three in a row. To progress, players need to collect sufficient quantities of each element within a limited number of moves. Once a player has collected enough of each element, the game goes into “Hero Mode,” enabling the player to boost his or her score through careful use of the remaining moves.

Source: The Developer Website.

155785.name: Ninja Warz
155785.description:
Ninja Warz is a fighting game. Players build an army of hand-picked Ninjas and engage in exciting combat with friends and enemies from around the world. Players train their Ninjas, equip them and battle in a number of arenas. Players compete in tournaments, earn rewards and equipment.

Users can engage in a number of mini-games to help their allies and earn gold and rewards. There are hundreds of unique achievements to unlock.

Source: The Developer Website.

155786.name: Light the Night
155786.description:
You are Darryl the lightning bug. One cool evening you’re minding your own business just flying along and you get struck by lightning launching you to epic speeds!

You enter a super slow-mo world full of light-giving lumens and dandelion power-ups as well as dangerous flowers, bugs, and rocks. Collect some, avoid the other, and travel as far through your world as you can before running out of light!

Earn epic upgrades ranging from great new Darryl looks like Fire Bug, Ninja Bug, Formal Bug and Robo-Bug.

Earn enhancing upgrades like lumen attraction, extra light, longer boosts and much more!

Masterfully collect dandelion power-ups like Invincibility, Instant Recharge, Pulse Wave, Dande-Shield, and Super Boost!

Complete missions, gain ranks, upgrade Darryl, and reach new exciting scenes with visually stunning backdrops!

Think you’ve mastered it? Use Game Center to compare best distance and achievements with your friends!

Source: The Developer Website.

155787.description:
This expansion focuses on Japanese food and the enjoyment of eating it. It contains Japanese food-related nouns, verbs, adjectives, adverbs, and a few particles for balance. Examples include Ramen, Sushi, Tempura, Eat, Cook, Fry, Delicious, Nightly, and Never.

Each expansion to Japanese: The Game adds new vocabulary words, and thus the rules that go along with how each noun, verb, or particle can be placed to make a sentence.

The expansion decks are shuffled in with the main deck to accommodate more players (the game plays 2 by itself and needs either an additional core deck or an expansion to accommodate more), or just to add less common words to the mix for 1-2 players.
155787.name: Japanese: The Game – Food Expansion

155788.description:
This deck will help you become more fluent with words you’ll hear in Anime (and some manga) and in conversations about it, such as Fanatic, Space, Magic, Shut up, and Upperclassman.

Each expansion to Japanese: The Game adds new vocabulary words, and thus the rules that go along with how each noun, verb, or particle can be placed to make a sentence.

The expansion decks are shuffled in with the main deck to accommodate more players (the game plays 2 by itself and needs either an additional core deck or an expansion to accommodate more), or just to add less common words to the mix for 1-2 players.
155788.name: Japanese: The Game – Anime Expansion

155789.description:
This 36-card Travel Expansion is geared to teach you words you’ll need to get around in Japan. Words like Hotel, Where, and Bathroom as well as Pay, Taxi, Fare, Train, and Ticket will make your adventures in the Land of the Rising Sun more comfortable and less stressful.

Each expansion to Japanese: The Game adds new vocabulary words, and thus the rules that go along with how each noun, verb, or particle can be placed to make a sentence.

The expansion decks are shuffled in with the main deck to accommodate more players (the game plays 2 by itself and needs either an additional core deck or an expansion to accommodate more), or just to add less common words to the mix for 1-2 players.
155789.name: Japanese: The Game – Travel Expansion

155790.description:
This 36-card Business Expansion Deck brings you vocabulary appropriate to the office and business transactions. Words like “Profit,” “Office,” “Co-worker,” “Commute,” and “Boss” are included along with a mix of particles and other words that allow these cards to integrate into a Core Deck without any loss of play balance.

Each expansion to Japanese: The Game adds new vocabulary words, and thus the rules that go along with how each noun, verb, or particle can be placed to make a sentence.

The expansion decks are shuffled in with the main deck to accommodate more players (the game plays 2 by itself and needs either an additional core deck or an expansion to accommodate more), or just to add less common words to the mix for 1-2 players.
155790.name: Japanese: The Game – Business Expansion

155791.description:
This 36-card Expansion Deck brings your Japanese grammar concepts up to an intermediate level. You’ll be able to conjugate Verbs, Adjectives, and certain Copulas to many different tenses, including:

Past Tense
Negative
Command Form
Polite Request Form
Invitation/Volitional Form
and many more!

Much of this isn’t discussed until the third semester of college. But you can integrate this after one or two days of getting used to Japanese: The Game’s Core Deck, maybe sooner.
155791.name: Japanese: The Game – Conjugations Expansion

155792.name: Rethink Tomorrow
155792.description:
Abstract Strategy Tile laying/Card game with Climate change theme reflecting the hunt for clean energy.

The game is for 2 to 4 players aged 7 to adult.

The game was developed in cooperation with Novozymes and was designed by Steen Riisgaard.

Contents are:

Mounted playing board.

Four sets of plastic playing bricks in red,yellow,green, and blue
comprising of 8 X 1 square bricks, 8 x 2 square bricks, and 8 x 3 square bricks.

48 one square black `consequence` bricks.

36 white `Clean energy bricks` comprising of
12 x 1 square bricks, 12 x 2 square bricks, 12 x 3 square bricks.

24 Rethink cards

32 Consequence cards

1 sheet of rules.

The object of the game is to collect all the stores of clean energy printed around the board, while making the most efficient overall use of the energy required to reach the clean energy points on the board. Symbols of clean energy come in the form of 1,2,or 3 white square bricks which are taken when one of his tiles covers (or partially covers) a white energy space on the board.

On a players turn he may place either a 1, 2 or 3 square brick on the board, providing the placed brick shorter side comes into contact with a `tail end` of a previously placed brick.

The board also has catastrophe and rethink symbols which when covered ( or partially covered by a players brick force a player to draw the corresponding card from the deck which he reads aloud and all players follow the event of the card.

The game ends when either the white energy symbols on the board have been covered and collected, or each player has 10 black consequence bricks in their possession.

At the conclusion of the game players add up the totals of their Plus energy bricks that have been placed on the board, minus the black consequence bricks they have, to give a final
energy point score.

The player with the higher Plus energy is declared the winner.

155793.description:
This 36-card Kaijuu Expansion Deck contains Monsters and words relevant to their lifestyle, such as “Radioactive,” “Beasts,” “Devour,” and “Tokyo.”

Each expansion to Japanese: The Game adds new vocabulary words, and thus the rules that go along with how each noun, verb, or particle can be placed to make a sentence.

The expansion decks are shuffled in with the main deck to accommodate more players (the game plays 2 by itself and needs either an additional core deck or an expansion to accommodate more), or just to add less common words to the mix for 1-2 players.
155793.name: Japanese: The Game - Kaijuu Expansion

155794.description:
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Thomas Cook travel company, located in the UK.

This special edition of Monopoly celebrates the growth of travel in the UK through the years.

Monopoly Overview
Players take the part of land owners, attempting to buy and then develop their land. Income is gained by other players visiting their properties and money is spent when they visit properties belonging to other players. When times get tough, players may have to mortgage their properties to raise cash for fines, taxes and other misfortunes.

Game play
On his turn, a player rolls two dice and moves that number of spaces around the board. If the player lands on an as-yet-unowned property, he has the opportunity to buy it and add it to his portfolio or allow the bank to auction it to the highest bidder. If a player owns all the spaces within a color group, he may then build houses and hotels on these spaces, generating even more income from opponents who land there. If he lands on a property owned by another player, he must pay that player rent according to the value of the land and any buildings on it. There are other places on the board which can not be bought, but instead require the player to draw a card and perform the action on the card, pay taxes, collect income, or even go to jail.

Goal
The goal of the game is to be the last player remaining with any money.
155794.name: Monopoly: Thomas Cook edition

155795.name: Isotope
155795.description:
User Summary:

Isotope is an RPG by Tony Dowler that "you can use to explore the Titan's Sarcophagus map [Tony] released earlier this month. It includes a low-res copy of the map. This is a super-minimal game. The rules are sparse. Meant for experienced players."

155796.name: Papa Pear Saga
155796.description:
Papa Pear Saga is a physics-based game with a tropical theme and over 290 levels. The game format features elements of pinball and pachinko. Players have to shoot “Papa Pear” from a cannon at the top of the screen in order to have him fall into buckets at the bottom of the screen. If players select the right trajectory and power, Papa Pear will hit different elements such as acorns, other pears and carrots. This will help clear the screen, making it easier to hit the buckets and improve the score for the level. Different levels have additional objectives, such as eliminating the right number of acorns or carrots within the allocated number of shots. Once Papa Pear has landed in all the buckets, the level ends in a “Pear Fiesta” as all remaining Papa Pears dive into play. Papa Pear Saga was launched on King.com in June 2012, on Facebook in May 2013 and on mobile in November 2013.

Source: The Developer Website.

155797.name: Pet Rescue Saga
155797.description:
Pet Rescue Saga is a clicker game in which players click on groups of similarly coloured blocks in order to clear them from the screen. The game offers over 440 levels of play in an animal-themed adventure where players have to rescue a range of cute pets from the evil Snatchers. The aim is to clear enough blocks to guide pets to safety at the bottom of the screen while also achieving the minimum score required. Players need to think through the consequences of removing any one set of blocks as this will cause other blocks to move sideways or fall into play. Pet Rescue Saga also offers additional challenges in the form of caged pets, stony floors that require a key to unlock and diamonds that can only be removed by landing them on a stony floor. Pet Rescue Saga was launched on King.com in September 2009, on Facebook in November 2012, and on mobile in June 2013.

Source: The Developer Website.

155798.name: Miscrits of Sunfall Kingdom
155798.description:
Welcome to the world of Miscria, a mysterious and adventurous land. In it you'll find a world to explore, creatures to discover, and an adventure the likes of which has never graced the pages of Facebook. Miscrits of Sunfall Kingdom is an exciting, rich, expansive game that will capture you from the first few moments and keep you with its enchanting qualities throughout.

Players begin in the enchanting Miscrian Forest, and soon find themselves on a search for the mysterious critters known as Miscrits. Discovering and capturing new Miscrits is just the beginning, as players can then train them, watch them grow and evolve, and use them to battle not only more difficult wild creatures but live players in the exclusive Sunfall Stadium Battle Arena.

Source: The Developer Website.

155799.name: Miscrits of Volcano Island
155799.description:
Welcome to Volcano Island, the next land in the world of Miscria. Hundreds of new Miscrits to capture, train and battle in this exciting, rich, and even more expansive game.

The world of Miscria invites players to experience Facebook gaming in a whole new way. Packed with rich, inventive content, Miscrits will captivate players with its vast array of art, special effects and animation, exclusive creatures and special content, and dynamic PVP gameplay that players have never experienced in Facebook gaming to date.

Source: The Developer Website.

155800.name: Pay Me Money
155800.description:
From the developer:

PAY ME MONEY is a multi-player board game available for iOS where players take turns rolling the dice and move their game piece across a square board. The purpose of the game is buy as many properties as possible and to taking rent every time an opponent lands on your property.

PAY ME MONEY let's you add houses to properties in order to increase the rent, as well as exchange properties and cash over the game center network.

Theme characters in the game include 'the man' and a 'ninja sniper' who can be hired to shoot your opponents.

PAY ME MONEY let's you choose 1 of 4 game pieces, namely: a dog, a gun, a bag of money, or a car.

PAY ME MONEY is recommended for mature audiences due to the use of: profanity and animated violence.

155802.description:
Each player in Korrigans has two korrigans (a.k.a. fairies or spirits) and must use them to move about the landscape, claim animal tokens in order to access other parts of the land, and eventually find the pot of gold that will become visible once the rainbow's location is revealed.

In more detail, players take their first two turns to place their korrigans on the game board; with each korrigan you place, you look at the tokens in that location and keep one of them. These tokens show either gold (which possibly gives you points at the end of the game) or an animal (which allows you to pass through gates that bear that animal to reach a different landscape). From the third turn on, players use their animal tokens to move their korrigans and pick up more tokens. Each round the player holding the bag draws a rainbow token and places it in one of the rows or columns on the board; this means that the pot of gold won't appear in this row or column in the final part of the game.

Once the gold is finally placed on the game board, players have a final round in which they try to reach the pot with their korrigans. If a player reaches the pot with one korrigan, he scores 10 points and if both of his korrigans reach the pot he scores 15 points. Whoever has the highest score wins!
155802.name: Korrigans

155803.name: Dogfight (1980)
155803.description:
Dogfight is an aerial combat video game released for the Apple II computer in 1980. A later version, Dogfight II, is copyrighted 1983. It is essentially a shoot 'em up style game, with the player controlling an aircraft which they can steer in one axis (left or right) and shoot. Similar to Asteroids, the screen wraps around at the edges, such that a player heading off the right edge of the screen will re-enter from the left.

Players can play solo against the computer, or, in a system very unusual in video games, up to 8 humans can play against each other. Since all control is via the single built-in keyboard of the Apple II, this involves the players crowding up against each other to reach their 3 keys. Each plane is identified by a number drawn next to it.

When a plane is shot, it becomes a parachuting figure, which transits the screen from top to bottom a few times and also may be shot.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dogfight (1980 video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

155804.name: Hotel Lobby
155804.description:
From the Introduction

Someplace downtown one can happen upon this hotel. It is not one of the most luxurious or famous hotels, but the marble and glass facade as well as the clean red carpet and the polished brass promise moderate luxuries at the very least. The hotel's lobby takes up a good part of the building's ground floor. It is dominated by the large check in counter that is staffed at all times, day and night, with helpful personal. A double column of large potted plants will lead any visitor there first. Heavy couches made from polished hardwood and expensive leather, grouped around stylish low glass tables, are the other dominating feature of the room.

155805.name: Inn at the Crossroads
155805.description:
From the Introduction

This small in is situated where two important trade routes meet. Although neither road is much better than a dirt path they are well traveled. This might be because less tolls and fees are collected on these roads for the purpose of maintenance and providing security. For the latter reason though the few small ins along the roads are welcome sight to wary travelers. The same is true for this one. Although it only has a small common room and a few small rooms with beds it still promises a nights rest in moderate safety and possibly a fresh beer or two for a change.

155806.name: Overgrown Temple Ruin
155806.description:
From the Introduction

In ages past a small but well built and beautifully decorated temple graced this spot. These days only ruins remain. The temple's gold and silver decorations have been looted long ago and with time the harsh weather washed away the colors with which many of the stones were painted as well. Even many of the stones of walls and columns alike have been carried off to be recycled in newer constructions. And maybe no evidence would have remained of this structure if not for the forest which began to cover much of the surrounding landscape through the years. Today these ruins lie mostly forgotten. Only a few Gothic tales still tell of the old temple and the ghosts supposedly haunting it.

155807.name: Ballroom
155807.description:
From the Introduction

The ballroom one of the most prominent and representative parts of a mansion. This one is certainly a good example. The mansions owner has not spared any expanses. The floor is tiles with imported marble of various colors while the walls are paneled with two kinds of polished hardwood. New fashioned gas lamps, the latest craze, provide illumination. Their brass provides a contrast to the marble and wood, as does the brass railing of the wide double flight of stairs leading down into the park like garden surrounding the mansion. High windows made of the clearest glass available at the time allow guests to gaze out into the garden as well. A small number of small but exquisite glass tables and frail looking but sturdy chairs allow exhausted revelers to recover their breath or eat and drink some of the little treats customarily provided by the waiters on staff before diving back into the wide open dance floor.

155808.name: Hotel Room
155808.description:
From the Introduction

The suite is probably not the most luxurious and certainly not the largest hotel suite out there. Still it offers considerable comfort to its occupants. The ensemble consists of one anteroom, one sitting room, two bedrooms, two bathrooms, two walk in closets and a sizable balcony. Marble and brass dominate these rooms together with the polished hardwood, glass and leather furniture. A curious detail are the interior doors of the suite, which are all glass doors, and the many mirrors. Closets, anteroom and bathrooms are all equipped with large mirrors, and even in the bedrooms the large flat screen screens have a mirror sheen when turned off.

155809.name: Under Construction
155809.description:
From the Introduction

At many large skyscraper or highrise building construction sites it is common practice that the finished lower floors are already rented out while higher floors are still being furnished and in some cases even higher floors are still under construction or not yet built at all. The case is similar here.

This floor is still a bare bones concrete skeleton for the better part and the signs of ongoing construction can be seen everywhere. Pipes, boards, sacks of cement, tiles and carpets are stacked everywhere and still await their eventual use.

Construction is making progress though, as the already tiles stairs up from the lower floor and the finished elevator indicate. Part of the floor has even been tiled already. Give the craftsmen a few more days to put in doors and plumbing as well as a few other odds and ends and the floor will be as good as finished.

155810.name: Thermal Bath
155810.description:
From the Introduction

The large thermal bath is a center of the town's social life. At its many pools anyone with the coin to spare will try to make an impression. Many a business deal or a marriage has been arranged in the relaxing water or beyond the curtains dividing the room on the loungers as well. A visit to the bath can be anything from relaxing to exciting. It can even be profitable.

The bath itself consists of many pools, surrounded by rows of column, balustrades and curtains suspended in between. The pools range from hot to cold but are in general not too deep. At their circumference bathers can seat and even at their center one can easily stand. While some loungers made from polished wood are provided in any room most bathers will lie on the marble of the floor as numerous pipes lead hot water or in some cases even steam through the floor giving it a comfortable warmth.

155811.name: Speeding Train
155811.description:
From the Introduction

Beyond the rails the sandy desert stretches in either direction to the very horizon, at least when the dust storms, which are quite common here about, don't severely restrict visibility. On some days one might not even be able to see beyond the reach of his arms. Currently though it would be possible to enjoy the monotonous panorama dotted by small rocks and the occasional cactus while the train speeds along.

This one is, with its ten freight cars, actually quite short compared to other trains on this route. It is after all not one of the trains pulling hundreds of heavily loaded ore carts. It is not one of the trains returning the empty carts either. This train's sole purpose is to supply the few maintenance stations along the route and the mines at its end, with water and other necessities. Among other things it carries the monthly pay for the employees.

155812.description:
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the U.S. Navy

Overview of Monopoly
Players take the part of land owners, attempting to buy and then develop their land. Income is gained by other players visiting their properties and money is spent when they visit properties belonging to other players. When times get tough, players may have to mortgage their properties to raise cash for fines, taxes and other misfortunes.

Game play
On his turn, a player rolls two dice and moves that number of spaces around the board. If the player lands on an as-yet-unowned property, he has the opportunity to buy it and add it to his portfolio or allow the bank to auction it to the highest bidder. If a player owns all the spaces within a color group, he may then build houses and hotels on these spaces, generating even more income from opponents who land there. If he lands on a property owned by another player, he must pay that player rent according to the value of the land and any buildings on it. There are other places on the board which can not be bought, but instead require the player to draw a card and perform the action on the card, pay taxes, collect income, or even go to jail.

Goal
The goal of the game is to be the last player remaining with any money.
155812.name: Monopoly: U.S. Navy

155813.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Swindon, in the United Kingdom.
155813.name: Monopoly: Swindon

rpg.10737: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

155814.name: Tales From the Fallen Empire Judge's Reference Screen
155814.description:
User Summary:

A GM screen for the Tales From the Fallen Empire setting for use with the Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG. It contains crit & fumble tables, a Turn Unholy chart, attack roll modifiers, and information on two-weapon attacks.

155815.name: Now You See It
155815.description:
FROM THE BOX:

The game based on the popular TV Programme NOW YOU SEE IT. One of the players acts as the reader, reads out the clues and stars the timer. The first player to stop the timer and name the hidden word scores the points.

The board game itself was based on the 1985-1993 Seven Network (then later Nine Network from 1998-1999) kids game show which in turn was based on the short-lived 1974-75 and 1989 adult game show from America of the same name.

155816.name: Angel
155816.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ministers of Grace Defend Us!

With the Angel, a new 10-level player character class for Labyrinth Lord (and other old-school fantasy role-playing games) you'll be an immortal being acting through divine guidance. Carried by divine wings and wielding a flaming sword, you'll bring light and justice to the darkest dungeons!

155817.name: The Archaeologist's Handbook
155817.description:
From publisher blurb:

A career in ruins…

Welcome to The Archaeologist's Handbook, a handy tome for all armchair adventurers who want to know more about playing characters who delve into the past and discover ancient treasures (or fascinating insights).

This book provides a firm framework for archaeology-based adventures and characters. Inside these pages you will find a trove of knowledge about the history of archaeology, field and laboratory techniques, famous sites, museums and more. Spiced with a few devious suggestions for play, this handy-sized volume will prove a boon to player and game master alike.

The Archaeologist's Handbook is written by a professional archaeologist with more than a decade of experience in both archaeology and roleplaying games.

155818.name: The Many Deaths of Edward Bigsby
155818.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Praise be to Her!" is the last thing Bigsby says. But who is Bigsby? What does he want? Why would anyone want to kill him?

These are the questions you must answer, and quickly. Else you might find out what's hiding behind the Green Door...

A Trail of Cthulhu scenario, compatible with Bookhounds of London, by the author of Pelgrane's Not So Quiet, Sisters of Sorrow, and other chilling tales!

155819.name: Wild Wizard
155819.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Chaos of the Arcane!

With the Wild Wizard, a a new 20-level player character class for Labyrinth Lord (and other old-school fantasy role-playing games) you'll harness the power of uncontrolled magic to bring arcane havoc down upon your foes (and maybe a few friends... and possibly yourself) as a variant on the classic magic-user!

boardgamehonor.26780: 2014 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee

155820.description:
Cyclades: Titans, the second expansion for Cyclades, includes a new game board with large islands on which ground attacks can be carried out as well as the Titans of Greek legend, who can conduct attacks without the help of Ares.

In the Cyclades archipelago, tension has reached a boiling point.
The conflict is now focused mainly on two large neighboring islands. With the help of the Gods, there are now 6 great cities of ancient Greece fighting for supremacy.
Now, more than ever, the war is raging. And on top of all that, Kronos decided to join the party, and with him comes a horde of Titans, ready to annihilate everything in their path…

The Titans expansion allows for up to 6 players, and offers 2 game modes:
• From 3 to 5: competitive game. « Everyone for himself » just like in the base game.
The goal is still to have two Metropolises at the end of a cycle.
• With 4 or 6 players: team-play (with teams of two) – The goal of each team is to have three metropolises at the end of a cycle.
With 4 players, one can decide to play either competitive OR in teams.
With 6 players, the team-play is MANDATORY.
155820.name: Cyclades: Titans

boardgamehonor.40226: 2016 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork & Presentation Nominee

155821.description:
Inis is a game deeply rooted in Celtic history and lore in which players win by being elected King of the Island (Inis). Players can try to achieve one of three different victory conditions:


Leadership: Be the leader — i.e., have more clan figures than any other player — of territories containing at least six opponents' clans.
Land: Have your clans present in at least six different territories.
Religion: Have your clans present in territories that collectively contain at least six sanctuaries.


Over the course of the game, players also earn deeds, typically chanted by bards or engraved by master crafters, that reduce by one the magic total of six for any condition. While one victory condition is enough to claim the title of King, a game of experienced players usually has a tight balance of power, emphasizing the leadership of the capital of the island.

At the start of each round, players draft a hand of four action cards (with 13 action cards for three players and 17 for four players) during the Assembly. Action cards not played at the end of one season are not held for the next. Players also have access to leader cards for the territories that allow it and where they were elected leader during the assembly. Each Assembly reallocates those cards. Finally, they collect "epic tales" cards that depict the deeds of the ancient Irish gods and heroes, like Cuchulainn, the Dagda, Lugh and many others. These will be kept and used to inspire the clans and achieve extraordinary feats...under the right circumstances. The cards provide a variety of actions: adding clans, moving clans, building/exploring, and special actions.

Careful drafting, hand management, bluffing (especially once players understand the importance of passing their turn), good timing, and a precise understanding of the balance of power are the keys to victory. After a discovery game you'll be ready for a full and epic game, where an undisputed player will be king by the Assembly for his merit and wisdom.

While Inis has "dudes" that are "on a map", it's a beginner's mistake to play this as a battle game because eliminating other clans reduces your chances of scoring a Leadership victory condition. Peace among different clans, with or without a clear territory leader, is the usual outcome of a clan's movement. Battles will occur, of course, as the Celtic clans can be unruly and a good player will listen to his clan's people (i.e., his hand of cards). That battle aspect is reflected in the clan's miniatures representing warriors. Woodsmen, shepherds and traders complete the set of twelve minis for each player; these occupations have no impact on the game, but give it flavor.
155821.name: Inis

boardgamehonor.26779: 2014 Golden Geek Best Children's Board Game Nominee

155822.description: A simpler version of Krosmaster: Arena, aimed at younger players (ages 7+), and targeted for mass market sale. The game will include four new character figures, simplified rules, and progressive scenarios, much like the Krosmaster: Arena rulebook. The box includes 2 double sided game boards, 30 XL scenario cards, the figures and Krosmaster cards for those figures, and a Krosmaster membership card for players to start an online account. The figures can also be used in the Krosmaster: Arena game.
155822.name: Krosmaster Junior

155823.description:
Part of Fleet: Arctic Bounty Kickstarter campaign. They will be available by other outlets

Quantity: 5

Bay Card: During setup, place all five Crab Meeples near the center of the play area.

A Crab Meeple is caught by the first full boat of each different Standard license in the game. If more than one player completes the criteria in the same phase and round, tie is broken by first in turn order. When a boat reaches capacity and is the first of its type to do so, that player immediately receives a Crab Meeple and places it on the license matching that boat. The Crab Meeple cannot be lost.

All Crab Meeples held at Game End are worth 4 VP
155823.name: Fleet: Crab Meeples

boardgamecompilation.187868: Fleet: Arctic Bounty – 54 Card Expansion Pack

155824.description:
Part of Fleet: Arctic Bounty Kickstarter campaign. They will be available by other outlets

Quantity: 4 + 16 Salmon Boat Cards

During setup, four Salmon licenses are added to the pool of Standard licenses and 16 Salmon Boat Cards are added to the Boat Card supply.

The Salmon licenses are purchased and played from the License Deck in the same manner as other license cards.

Once owned, a Salmon license gives a player the ability to
launch Salmon boats. A Salmon license also gives a player the ability to draw one Boat Card at the beginning of the Fishing Phase. The player can choose to either keep the card in hand OR tuck it under any already-Launched and Captained boat he owns. The tucked card will catch a Crate along with the boat during Fishing and has a capacity of four Crates.

One (1) Salmon license owned: Draw one card during Fishing; may keep the card in hand OR tuck it under an already-Launched and Captained boat they own.

Two (2) Salmon licenses owned: Draw two cards during Fishing; may keep the cards in hand OR tuck them under separate already-Launched and Captained boats they own.

Three (3) Salmon licenses owned: Draw three cards during Fishing; may keep the cards in hand OR tuck them under separate already-Launched and Captained boats they own.

Four (4) Salmon licenses owned: Draw four cards during Fishing; may keep the cards in hand OR tuck
155824.name: Fleet: Salmon License

boardgamecompilation.187868: Fleet: Arctic Bounty – 54 Card Expansion Pack

155825.description:
Part of Fleet: Arctic Bounty Kickstarter campaign. They will be available by other outlets

Quantity: 8

Dock Card: During setup, two First Mate cards per player
are placed face up on the table near the License Card deck

A First Mate on a boat that has reached its max capacity of Crates is worth 5VP. Otherwise, he is worth 2VP.
155825.name: Fleet: First Mate

boardgamecompilation.187868: Fleet: Arctic Bounty – 54 Card Expansion Pack

155826.description:
Part of Fleet: Arctic Bounty Kickstarter campaign. They will be available by other outlets

Quantity: 6

Bay Card: During setup, shuffle all Trophy Cards, randomly select three, and place them face up near the center of the play area.

Trophies are awarded to the first player to complete the criteria OR at Game End. If more than one player completes the criteria in the same phase and round, tie is broken by first in turn order.

Once a Trophy Card has been awarded, it cannot be lost. If there is a tie for a Game End Trophy, no one receives the Trophy

All Trophy Cards held at game end are worth 5 VP.

Trophy Card types:
First to Launch and Captain 4 Boats of the same Type
First to Launch and Captain 4 Boats of different Types
First to have 15 Crates on Launched Boats
First to have 3 of the same License Type
Most Launched Boats (Game End)
Most Standard Licenses (Game End)
155826.name: Fleet: Trophy Cards

155827.description: Unlike the head-to-head battles of Krosmaster: Arena, Krosmaster: Quest can be played "cooperatively" (with one player as the "demon" and the rest of the players working together), or as a competition as players look for treasures on tiled boards. The box includes seven new Krosmaster figures with character cards (two exclusive), more than 600 pieces, 16 terrain parts (which can be used in Arena), more than 40 settings, and 6 special dice.
155827.name: Krosmaster: Quest

boardgamecompilation.187868: Fleet: Arctic Bounty – 54 Card Expansion Pack

155828.description:
Part of Fleet: Arctic Bounty Kickstarter campaign. They will be available by other outlets

Quantity: 8

Dock Card: During setup, two House Boat cards per player
are placed face up on the table near the Boat Card supply.

House Boat can be purchased during the Launch Phase for 3 coin and then discarded at anytime for 5 coin. It is a great cash spike! If you somehow manage not to use it, good luck, its worth 2VP at game end!
155828.name: Fleet: House Boat

boardgamecompilation.187868: Fleet: Arctic Bounty – 54 Card Expansion Pack

155829.description:
Part of Fleet: Arctic Bounty Kickstarter campaign. They will be available by other outlets

Using a combination of Fleet and Fleet: Arctic Bounty along with the Charter Boats, Fleet will be able to be played with 5 and 6 players! All 12 Charter Boat Cards are added to the Boat Card supply. Charter Boats can be launched under any license!

The Charter Boats can also be used as a mix in at any player count to spice Fleet up even more.
155829.name: Fleet: Charter Boat Cards

155830.name: Lucky Shot
155830.description:
The object of the game is to get your own tiddlywinks into three cups worth either 25 or 50 points. Players take turns flicking their winks onto the board, trying to land them in the cups. There are some free turn spaces on the board, and if players land their pieces there, they can take another turn.

If players miss the cups, they can place an additional piece on the board, and on additional turns, players can either flick their winks or roll a die to move their piece on the board. When they land their piece on a color that matches their pieces, they can make another attempt to flick a wink into a cup. If they manage to get their piece to the end of the trail, they place one of their winks into the cup at the end of their trail and take their piece back.

The cups at the end of the trails are worth 25 points each, while the one that can only be reached by the tiddlywinks is worth 50 points. The game ends when one player has all four of his winks in the cups, and players total up the points of all their winks. Whoever has the highest points wins the game.

155831.name: World Eaters
155831.description:
The Emperor is dead. Dragon Empire stands on the brink of destruction as four evil forces try to conquer the last place standing: the capitol — but then another threat looms, an alien invasion force that just wants to devour our world.

World Eaters gives players the chance to play as four main evils (Orcs, Demons, Undead, Cold ones) and to conquer as much terrain as they can by rolling dice, recruiting armies, then sending them to fight by collecting dice pools.

As much as evil will act brutally - that much Burn they collect and that much retaliation from Empire they will get. On Map 9x9 there will be cities to attack and either plunder them or conquer to gain resources bringing players closer to victory.

On their turn each player will throw dice depending on their logistic power to bring more troops, send them for quest, prepare the attack, build forts or sending spies to see the defense on city they wish to attack.

155833.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Wolverhampton, in the United Kingdom.
155833.name: Monopoly: Wolverhampton

155834.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.
